messages.title: A BRIGHTER FUTURE FOR OUR MENTAL HEALTH SERVICES
messages.content:
The NHS may be the envy of the world, but our mental health service is not. People are struggling. When they turn for help, it is often not there. Waiting times for mental health services are; on average, 14 weeks - just for an assessment - before support and care has even begun. Problems that can start small, become crises as help is either not available, or arrives late.

The Liberal Democrats have a plan to tackle this. They have pledged to ring-fence funding and put extra investment into services. They will also ensure services run 24 hours a day, seven days a week.

The Liberal Democrats will increase mental health staffing and will ensure that, by 2025, 100% of children and young people with diagnosable conditions get NHS treatment.

Liberal Democrat Leader Jo Swinson said: 'For many years, mental health has been overlooked by Conservative and Labour governments.

' My government will ensure these patients no longer face shamefully long waiting times and are treated with the same care as those with physical illnesses.

We will ensure our mental health services are there for everyone who needs them.'

messages.title: FUNDED BY THE REMAIN BONUS
messages.content:
Jeremy Corbyn’s Labour party are determined to pursue Brexit. But whether it’s a Conservative or a Labour Brexit it would be catastrophic for the UK.

A vote for the Liberal Democrats is a vote to stop Brexit. Stopping Brexit means that we can focus on tackling the big issues facing the UK right now.

Our economy will grow more quickly, providing a Remain Bonus that we will invest in our public services.

Once we stop Brexit, we can build a brighter future where we tackle the climate emergency and inequality, properly fund schools and the NHS, and create opportunity for all.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: The Liberal Democrats plan to tackle the mental health crisis by increasing mental health staffing and ensuring that by 2025, 100% of children and young people with diagnosable conditions get NHS treatment.
The Liberal Democrats propose to stop Brexit, stating that it will allow the UK economy to grow more quickly, providing a Remain Bonus that can be invested in public services.
